text: in terms of you know kind of the the
things that I didn't expect um I think I
didn't expect the experience to be as
intense um a lot of people that I talked
to who went to business school said oh
it's a two-year vacation uh you should
have a lot of fun it's going to be party
all the time but that's definitely not
the experience at HBS HBS program is
very rigorous um the workload is intense
um and it's very challenging uh but I
think that the way that the curriculum
is T taught um in the classroom with the
case method in addition to a lot of the
group projects that we do together um is
very interesting and very Dynamic I
think that HBS forces you to build your
interpersonal skills because you work in
so many teams you do projects together
sometimes even cases you take exams
together so they force you to kind of
work through any kind of issues that you
may have you know working in teams or
building relationships and in groups and
I think in addition to learning you know
that fundamental uh core area core area
of business so I think that that's kind
of the D Dynamic learning piece where
you know if you're kind of working in
these silos or you're by yourself or
you're just learning through the lecture
method you don't get that kind of
well-rounded skill set development uh in
that particular program so I really like
that about hbs's curriculum and the way
it's taught here
